metadata.title: CVE-2018-9517 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In pppol2tp_connect, there is possible memory corruption due to a use afterfree. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with Systemexecution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID:A-38159931.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9517` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1053-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1053.57
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-snapdragon - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-10.11').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1006.7').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1053.57').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-hwe package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oem package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
linux-oracle package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9').
